title: Setting test-ssl-port to 0 and disabling insecure requests causes rest-assured tests to fail
body:
### Describe the bug

When using the config below, quarkus doesn't set up the rest-assured URL to include the actual https port, but uses port 0 instead.

This causes rest-assured to throw an exception when calling `RestAssured.given()`.

Reproducer config:
```yaml
quarkus:
  http:
    host: "0.0.0.0"
    test-ssl-port: 0
    insecure-requests: disabled
    ssl:
      certificate:
        files: cert.crt
        key-files: cert.key

```



### Expected behavior

The default url for rest-assured includes the actual port quarkus selected during startup

### Actual behavior

rest-assured throws "java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Port must be greater than 0"
